questions.question: What is HTML?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is a markup language used to create the structure and content of web pages.

questions.question: What is the purpose of HTML?

options.C: To structure and present content on web pages
options.D: To interact with users on web pages

questions.explanation: HTML defines the meaning and structure of web content. It tells browsers how to display the elements on a web page.

questions.question: What are HTML elements?
questions.explanation: HTML elements are the fundamental components of an HTML page. They are defined by tags and typically consist of a start tag, content, and an end tag.

questions.question: What is the correct syntax for an HTML element?
questions.explanation:
An HTML element typically starts with an opening tag, contains content, and ends with a closing tag. For example, `

This is a paragraph.

`.

questions.question: What are HTML attributes?
questions.explanation: HTML attributes provide additional information about HTML elements. They are always specified in the start tag and usually come in name/value pairs like `name="value"`.

questions.question: What is the correct syntax for an HTML attribute?
questions.explanation: Attributes are placed within the opening tag of an HTML element and follow the `attribute="value"` format. For example, `<a href="https://www.example.com">`.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define the most important heading?
questions.explanation: The `<h1>` tag defines the most important heading in an HTML document, typically displayed with the largest font size by default.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define a paragraph?
questions.explanation:
The `

` tag is used to define a paragraph of text. Browsers typically add some whitespace (margin) before and after a paragraph.

questions.question: What are inline styles?

options.A: Styles defined within the HTML element
options.B: Styles defined in an external CSS file
options.C: Styles defined in the <head> section of the HTML document
options.D: Styles inherited from the parent element

questions.explanation: Inline styles are CSS styles applied directly to an individual HTML element using the `style` attribute. This is generally discouraged for larger projects due to maintainability.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to make text bold?
questions.explanation: The `<b>` tag is used to make text bold. While `<strong>` also makes text bold, `<b>` is for stylistic emphasis without semantic importance, whereas `<strong>` indicates strong importance.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define a blockquote?
questions.explanation: The `<blockquote>` tag is used to define a section that is quoted from another source. Browsers typically indent `<blockquote>` elements.

questions.question: How do you add a comment in HTML?
questions.explanation: HTML comments are written using ``. Content within these tags is ignored by the browser and is not displayed on the web page.

questions.question: How can you specify a color in HTML?
questions.explanation: Colors in HTML can be specified using predefined color names (e.g., 'red'), RGB values (e.g., `rgb(255, 0, 0)`), or hexadecimal values (e.g., `#FF0000`).

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The `<a>` tag (anchor tag) is used to create hyperlinks, which link one web page to another or to a different part of the same page. The `href` attribute specifies the destination URL.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to embed an image in an HTML page?
questions.explanation: The `` tag is used to embed an image into an HTML document. It is a self-closing tag and requires the `src` attribute to specify the image source.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define a table row?
questions.explanation: The `<tr>` tag defines a row within an HTML table.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define an unordered list?
questions.explanation: The `<ul>` tag is used to define an unordered (bulleted) list. List items within it are defined by `<li>` tags.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <div> tag?

options.A: To define a division or section in an HTML document

questions.explanation: The `<div>` tag is a generic container for flow content. It has no semantic meaning but is commonly used to group and style blocks of content with CSS.

questions.question: How do you assign a class to an HTML element?
questions.explanation: The `class` attribute is used to assign one or more class names to an HTML element. This allows multiple elements to share the same styling or JavaScript behavior.

questions.question: How do you assign an ID to an HTML element?
questions.explanation: The `id` attribute is used to assign a unique identifier to a single HTML element within a document. IDs are often used to target specific elements with CSS or JavaScript.
